intro: Bumelia montana, commonly known as the mountain bumelia, is a deciduous shrub native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough, textured surface. Bumelia montana produces small, clustered flowers that are followed by orange to red berries, which are an important food source for wildlife.
